We’re preparing Lubuntu 14.10, the Utopic Unicorn, for distribution in October 2014. With this early Beta pre-release, you can see what we are trying out in preparation for our next version. We have some interesting things happening, so read on for highlights and information. 

'''NOTE:''' This is an beta pre-release. 
Lubuntu Pre-releases are NOT recommended for:
* Regular users who are not aware of pre-release issues
* Anyone who needs a stable system
* Anyone uncomfortable running a possibly frequently broken system
* Anyone in a production environment with data or workflows that need to be reliable

Lubuntu Pre-releases ARE recommended for:
* Regular users who want to help us test by finding, reporting, and/or fixing bugs
* Lubuntu developers

== Getting Lubuntu 14.10 Beta 1 ==

=== Upgrading from Previous Versions ===
To upgrade to Lubuntu 14.10 from previous releases, follow the <nowiki>[[ http:--manpages.ubuntu.com-manpages-precise-man8-do-release-upgrade.8.html|Upgrade Instructions]]</nowiki>.

=== Download a Disk Image ===
* <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/lubuntu/releases/utopic/beta-1/|Bootable images for standard PCs/laptops/netbooks]]</nowiki>

Instructions for burning the image to a DVD or USB flash drive can be found on the <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto|Burning ISO Howto]]</nowiki>.

We recommend you learn how to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.org/HowToMD5SUM|check your image file]]</nowiki> so your pre-release is as it’s supposed to be. Compare your MD5 checksum with the correct ones found <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/lubuntu/releases/utopic/beta-1/MD5SUMS|alongside the images]]</nowiki>.

== Beta 1 Highlights ==

Lubuntu development is currently focused on the transition away from GTK+ to the Qt framework. This is not stable enough for everyday use, so the focus this version is on fixing bugs.

=== Linux Kernel ===
The Beta 1 Utopic Unicorn snapshot includes the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/3.16.0-11.16|3.16.0-11 Ubuntu Linux kernel]]</nowiki> which is based on the the upstream <nowiki>[[https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v3.x/linux-3.16.tar.gz|v3.16 Linux kernel]]</nowiki>. The 3.16 release includes mixed mode UEFI support, as well as improvements to suspend and resume times, open-source graphics drivers, newer laptop support ACPI and power management, ext4 filesystem, audio and sound, to name a few; additional highlights are described <nowiki>[[https://www.linux.com/news/software/linux-kernel/775452-the-top-features-of-the-linux-315-kernel|here]]</nowiki>.

== Known Problems ==

* There are no ppc images due to a lack of official testing. We would like to continue to support these architectures, but we need testers! If you have this hardware, please <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Lubuntu/Testing/PPC%26Mac64|join the official testing]]</nowiki>. The documentation is required for images to be released.

=== Lubuntu Desktop ===

* <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/lxpanel/+bug/1334088|power manager has wierd black background on lxpanel]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/1272834|obconf segfaults with the --tab option]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/1353661|Online help link in hardinfo under help menu redircters to Berlios.de]]</nowiki>

== Feedback ==

Development of Lubuntu 14.10, the Utopic Unicorn is ongoing and bugs are fixed every day.  Before reporting bugs, please ensure your system is up to date.  For verifying installation related bugs, updated disk images are available from <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/lubuntu/daily-live/current/|Daily bootable images for standard PCs/laptops/netbooks]]</nowiki>.

Please feel free to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Lubuntu/ContactUs|contact us]]</nowiki> with feedback.
